subject: Career
title: Freelancer Rate Setting
description: A quick, practical guide to Freelancer Rate Setting.

hook.text: A freelancer charges $50/hour. Their full-time equivalent would earn $120K. They're massively underpaid.

buildup.text: Freelancers must cover taxes, insurance, retirement, equipment, and unbilled hours.

discovery.text: The rule of thumb: your hourly rate should be roughly 2-3x what a salaried employee earns per hour.

twist.text: Clients compare your rate to employee costs. Educating them on total cost prevents sticker shock.

climax.text: Project-based pricing often beats hourly â€” it ties pay to value, not time.

punchline.text: Freelancers: charge for the value, not the hours.

quiz.question: How should freelance rates compare to equivalent salaried hourly pay?
options: 2-3x higher to cover taxes and benefits
